===={{anchor|April violence}}Continued violence ====
===={{anchor|April violence}}Continued violence ====

[[File:Syrian Army in Daraa 9 April 2011.jpg|thumb|left|Armed security forces in Daraa, 9 April]]
+
[[File:Syrian Army in Daraa 9 April 2011.jpg|thumb|right|Armed security forces in Daraa, 9 April]]
Two days later, al-Assad spoke to the People's Assembly in a televised speech, stating that he expected his government to lift the emergency law the following day, and acknowledging there is a gap between citizens and the state, and that government has to "keep up with the aspirations of the people".<ref name="Syria to lift emergency law">{{cite news |title=Syria to lift emergency law |author= |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/04/20114161511286268.html |newspaper= |date=16 April 2011 |accessdate=17 April 2011}}</ref> On 19 April, the government approved a bill lifting the country's emergency laws.<ref name="AJ19411">{{cite news|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/04/2011419135036463804.html|title=Syria 'lifts emergency law' amid protests|date=19 April 2011|work=[[Al Jazeera]]|accessdate=19 April 2011}}</ref> This was the first time in 48 years that the state of emergency had been lifted.<ref name="AJ19411" /> On April 21, al-Assad signed the decrees for ending the state of emergency, abolishing the [[Judiciary of Syria#Security courts|Supreme State Security Court (SSSC)]], and regulating the right to peaceful demonstrations.<ref name=SANA220411>{{cite news|title=Decrees on Ending State of Emergency, Abolishing SSSC, Regulating Right to Peaceful Demonstration|newspaper=Syrian Arab News Agency|date=22 April 2011|url=http://sana.sy/eng/21/2011/04/22/342711.htm|accessdate=23 April 2011}}</ref><ref name=Reuters210411>{{cite news|title=Syria's Assad ends state of emergency|author=Khaled Yacoub Oweis, additional reporting by Mariam Karouny in Beirut; Suleiman al-Khalidi in Amman; Sami Aboudi in Cairo; writing by Yara Bayoumy; editing by Samia Nakhoul and Paul Taylor|newspaper=Reuters|date=21 April 2011|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/04/21/us-syria-idUSTRE72N2MC20110421|accessdate=21 April 2011}}</ref>
Two days later, al-Assad spoke to the People's Assembly in a televised speech, stating that he expected his government to lift the emergency law the following day, and acknowledging there is a gap between citizens and the state, and that government has to "keep up with the aspirations of the people".<ref name="Syria to lift emergency law">{{cite news |title=Syria to lift emergency law |author= |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/04/20114161511286268.html |newspaper= |date=16 April 2011 |accessdate=17 April 2011}}</ref> On 19 April, the government approved a bill lifting the country's emergency laws.<ref name="AJ19411">{{cite news|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/04/2011419135036463804.html|title=Syria 'lifts emergency law' amid protests|date=19 April 2011|work=[[Al Jazeera]]|accessdate=19 April 2011}}</ref> This was the first time in 48 years that the state of emergency had been lifted.<ref name="AJ19411" /> On April 21, al-Assad signed the decrees for ending the state of emergency, abolishing the [[Judiciary of Syria#Security courts|Supreme State Security Court (SSSC)]], and regulating the right to peaceful demonstrations.<ref name=SANA220411>{{cite news|title=Decrees on Ending State of Emergency, Abolishing SSSC, Regulating Right to Peaceful Demonstration|newspaper=Syrian Arab News Agency|date=22 April 2011|url=http://sana.sy/eng/21/2011/04/22/342711.htm|accessdate=23 April 2011}}</ref><ref name=Reuters210411>{{cite news|title=Syria's Assad ends state of emergency|author=Khaled Yacoub Oweis, additional reporting by Mariam Karouny in Beirut; Suleiman al-Khalidi in Amman; Sami Aboudi in Cairo; writing by Yara Bayoumy; editing by Samia Nakhoul and Paul Taylor|newspaper=Reuters|date=21 April 2011|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/04/21/us-syria-idUSTRE72N2MC20110421|accessdate=21 April 2011}}</ref>
